body.para: #region lets you specify a block of code that you can expand or collapse when using the outlining feature of the Visual Studio Code Editor. In longer code files, it is convenient to be able to collapse or hide one or more regions so that you can focus on the part of the file that you are currently working on. A #region block must be terminated with a #endregion directive.

A #region block cannot overlap with a #ifdef block or an #ifndef block. However, a #region block can be nested in a #ifdef or #ifndef block, and a #ifdef or #ifndef block can be nested in a #region block.
